page.title: 17INTERESTING BUILDINGS
page.content: The largest and most important building after the church was Court Lodge which was dismantled in l9l2 and re_erected in Groombridge. Kent. Other houses were mainly farmhouses of which these survive:_ Pickdick, Stonelink, Sowdens, 15thC hall house with jettied east end; Hundred House, thatched weather_board; Maidlands, timber_framed at rear with brick front extension; Newmans, small weatherboarded; Billingham, 17thC with squared framing; Pound House, 15th C, later extended; Vines, hall house at rear with Regency front; Stocks, all tile hung; Parsonage, mainly 19thC with earlier parts; Tibbs, tile_hung; Knellstone, important 15thC timber studding, part tile_hung; Cross House, 18thC weatherboarded; Snailham, 17thC; Old School l898, brick; Old chapel,19thC (Methodist) now a joinery
